suggested_query: The floor's solidity was disrupted by the softness of the area rug, which was a deliberate choice to create a sense of disorientation. The artwork itself was a critique of the very notion of solidity, questioning the nature of the floor as a stable platform. As I stood there, I felt the rug's softness seep into my very being, challenging my assumption of the floor as a fixed entity. The floor's materiality was being rewritten before my eyes, and I was forced to recalibrate my understanding of this fundamental aspect of the built environment.
